page.title: 12EDUCATION
page.content: There are two schools in Donemana.One of them is for Catholics with 75 pupils on roll,employing 3 teachers. The other school is for non-catholics with a staff of 6 and an enrolment of 120.Many of the children attending both schools are transported by school buses.Both schools open at 9.15am and close at 3pm with a 15minute break in the morning and half an hour for lunch. School meals are made in kitchens attached to both schools.A school meal can be bought for 60p daily but approx 60% of the children have a free dinner due to their parents circumstances. Milk can be purchased in schools at 3p per third pint bottle,the school milk being subsidised by grants from E.E.C.funds.Apart from the usual subjects more time is spent on science computers,languages and health ed.
